reg_info.act_under: Wild Rice Harvesting Act   Loi sur la moisson du riz sauvage

content.content:
1. (1) Ontario is divided into the wild rice harvesting areas shown on the plans filed in the office of the Surveyor General under the numbers in Column 1 of the following Table on the dates shown opposite in Column 2 of the Table.  O. Reg. 216/09, s. 1 (1). (2) Each wild rice harvesting area shown on the plans listed in Column 1 of the following Table is situate in whole or in part in the geographic area, as described in Ontario Regulation 180/03 (Division of Ontario into Geographic Areas) made under the Territorial Division Act, 2002, listed opposite in Column 3 of the Table.  O. Reg. 216/09, s. 1 (2). TABLE   wild rice harvesting areas  Column 1   Column 2   Column 3 

  Plan number   Date of Plan   General Location 

  294   March 30, 2009   Kenora 

  295   March 30, 2009   Rainy River 

  296   March 30, 2009   Thunder Bay 

  297   March 30, 2009   Kenora, Thunder Bay O. Reg. 216/09, s. 1, Table.
content.raw_html:
1. (1) Ontario is divided into the wild rice harvesting areas shown on the plans filed in the office of the Surveyor General under the numbers in Column 1 of the following Table on the dates shown opposite in Column 2 of the Table.  O. Reg. 216/09, s. 1 (1).

(2) Each wild rice harvesting area shown on the plans listed in Column 1 of the following Table is situate in whole or in part in the geographic area, as described in Ontario Regulation 180/03 (Division of Ontario into Geographic Areas) made under the Territorial Division Act, 2002, listed opposite in Column 3 of the Table.  O. Reg. 216/09, s. 1 (2).

content.content: 2. (1) An application for a licence shall be in the form that the Deputy Minister approves.  O. Reg. 216/09, s. 2 (1). (2) The fee for a licence is $1.  O. Reg. 216/09, s. 2 (2).
content.raw_html:
2. (1) An application for a licence shall be in the form that the Deputy Minister approves.  O. Reg. 216/09, s. 2 (1).

(2) The fee for a licence is $1.  O. Reg. 216/09, s. 2 (2).

content.content: 3. (1) A licence shall be in the form that the Deputy Minister approves.  O. Reg. 216/09, s. 3 (1). (2) A licence expires on October 31 next after the date of issue.  O. Reg. 216/09, s. 3 (2). (3) A licence is not valid unless it is signed by the licensee.  O. Reg. 216/09, s. 3 (3).
content.raw_html:
3. (1) A licence shall be in the form that the Deputy Minister approves.  O. Reg. 216/09, s. 3 (1).

(2) A licence expires on October 31 next after the date of issue.  O. Reg. 216/09, s. 3 (2).

(3) A licence is not valid unless it is signed by the licensee.  O. Reg. 216/09, s. 3 (3).

content.content: 4. A licence shall not be transferred without the approval of the Deputy Minister.  O. Reg. 216/09, s. 4.
content.raw_html: 4. A licence shall not be transferred without the approval of the Deputy Minister.  O. Reg. 216/09, s. 4.

content.content: 5. Omitted (revokes other Regulations).  O. Reg. 216/09, s. 5.
content.raw_html: 5. Omitted (revokes other Regulations).  O. Reg. 216/09, s. 5.

content.content: 6. Omitted (provides for coming into force of provisions of this Regulation).  O. Reg. 216/09, s. 6.
content.raw_html: 6. Omitted (provides for coming into force of provisions of this Regulation).  O. Reg. 216/09, s. 6.
